If we apply the Laplace transform to \\( u(t) \\) and \\( v(t) \\) separately and calculate \\( L[u(t) + iv(t)] \\), will this result be the same as calculating \\( L[z(t)] \\) directly?
Explanation: The Laplace transform is a linear operator, meaning that \\( L[u(t) + iv(t)] = L[u(t)] + iL[v(t)] \\). Therefore, applying the Laplace transform to each component separately and then combining them will yield the same result as applying the transform directly to \\( z(t) \\).
